briefdescription.para: One degree in radians.
One radian in degrees.
Maximum recursion depth for the simpson integral rule.
Copies elements of vector b to vector a.
Copies elements of matrix b to matrix a.
Calculate dot product a[3] dot b[3].
Calculate cross product for 3D vectors c = a x b.

the mixed or triple product of three vectors (a cross b) dot c mathematica: a={a0,a1,a2};b={b0,b1,b2};c={c0,c1,c2};FullSimplify[Dot[Cross[a,b],c]] -(a2 b1 c0) + a1 b2 c0 + a2 b0 c1 - a0 b2 c1 - a1 b0 c2 + a0 b1 c2
Elementwise vector sum a = a + b.
Multiply vector elements with a scalar a = b*a.
Elementwise matrix sum a = a + b.
Multiply matrix a with scalar b: a = b*a.

Calculate unit vector b from a 3D vector a.
Convert cartesian coordinates xyz to cylindrical coordinates rpz.
Convert cylindrical coordinates rpz to cartesian coordinates xyz.
Transform vector from cylindrical to cartesian basis: vrpz -> vxyz, phi is the toroidal angle in radians.
Transform vector from cartesian to cylindrical basis: vxyz -> vrpz, phi is the toroidal angle in radians.
Direct expansion of 3x3 matrix determinant.
Convert degrees to radians.
Convert radians to degrees.
Convert a Jacobian from cylindrical to cartesian coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: This function converts a Jacobian located at angle phi and radius r from cylindrical to cartesian coordinates. The input Jacobian is an array with
[Br dBr/dr dBr/dphi dBr/dz Bphi dBphi/dr dBphi/dphi dBphi/dz Bz dBz/dr dBz/dphi dBz/dz]
an the output is
[Bx dBx/dx dBx/dy dBx/dz By dBy/dx dBy/dy dBy/dz Bz dBz/dx dBz/dy dBz/dz].

parameterdescription.para: input rpz coordinates in a 3-length array
output xyz coordinates in a 3-length array
r coordinate of the gradient
phi coordinate of the gradient

briefdescription.para: Convert a Jacobian from cartesian to cylindrical coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: This function converts a Jacobian located at angle phi and radius r from cartesian to cylindrical coordinates. The input Jacobian is an array with
[Bx dBx/dx dBx/dy dBx/dz By dBy/dx dBy/dy dBy/dz Bz dBz/dx dBz/dy dBz/dz]
an the output is
[Br dBr/dr dBr/dphi dBr/dz Bphi dBphi/dr dBphi/dphi dBphi/dz Bz dBz/dr dBz/dphi dBz/dz].

parameterdescription.para: output xyz coordinates in a 3-length array
input rpz coordinates in a 3-length array
r coordinate of the gradient
phi coordinate of the gradient

memberdef.argsstring: (real *matA, real *matB, int d1, int d2, int d3, real *matC)
memberdef.name: math_matmul

briefdescription.para: Matrix multiplication.

detaileddescription.para: This function performs matrix multiplication. The matrices are given as arrays, the indexing being row-wise.

parameterdescription.para: input array representing a d1 x d2 matrix
input array representing a d2 x d3 matrix
input scalar dimension (columns in matA and matC)
input scalar dimension (rows in matA and columns in matB)
input scalar dimension (rows in matB and matC)
output array representing a d1 x d3 matrix

briefdescription.para: Generate normally distributed random numbers.

detaileddescription.para: This function generates normally distributed random numbers with expected value of 0 and variance of 1 using the polar method [1]. The rand48 random number generator should be initialized with srand48() before calling this function.
[1] G. Marsaglia, T. A. Bray. A convenient method for generating normal variables. Siam Review 6.3 (1964): 260-264. http://epubs.siam.org/doi/abs/10.1137/1006063:w

xrefdescription.para: Currently only one of the generated numbers is returned; a second independent variate is Y = v2 * sqrt(-2*log(s) / s)
Try other random number generators such as those in Intel MKL

briefdescription.para: Calculate a^p where both a and p are integers (p >= 0)

parameterdescription.para: argument
power

memberdef.argsstring: (double(*f)(double), double a, double b, double epsilon)
memberdef.name: math_simpson

briefdescription.para: Adaptive Simpsons rule for integral.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses recursive splitting of the interval until either maximum number of intervals is reached or given relative error tolerance is obtained

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the integrand function (of one variable)
lower limit for the interval
upper limit for the interval
absolute tolerance

xrefdescription.para: Probably does not work with SIMD

memberdef.argsstring: (real *vec, real a, real b, int n)
memberdef.name: math_linspace

briefdescription.para: Generate linearly spaced vector.

detaileddescription.para: Generates linearly space vector with n elements whose end points are a and b. If n = 1, return b.

parameterdescription.para: n length array where result is stored
start point
end point
number of elements

memberdef.argsstring: (real q[3], real t1[3], real t2[3], real t3[3])
memberdef.name: math_point_on_plane

briefdescription.para: Find if a point is on a given plane.

detaileddescription.para: Let t1=(x1, y1, z1), t2=(x2, y2, z2), and t3=(x3, y3, z3) be non-collinear points on the plane. Let q =(x, y, z) be an arbitrary point. It lies in the plane if:
det( |x -x1 y -y1 z -z1| |x -x2 y -y2 z -z2| |x -x3 y -y3 z -z3| ) == 0

parameterdescription.para: xyz coordinates of a query point
xyz coordinates of the first point defining the plane
xyz coordinates of the second point defining the plane
xyz coordinates of the third point defining the plane

memberdef.argsstring: (real AP[3], real AB[3], real AC[3], real n[3], real *s, real *t)
memberdef.name: math_barycentric_coords_triangle

briefdescription.para: Find barycentric coordinates for a given point.

detaileddescription.para: Let a,b,c be the vertices of a triangle and p an arbitrary point. The s,t are the barycentric coordinates of p if: p = (1-s-t)*a + s*b + t*c

parameterdescription.para: point position vector [x,y,z]
triangle edge AB vector
triangle edge AC vector
normal vector [nx, ny, nz] of the triangle
evaluated s coordinate
evaluated t coordinate

briefdescription.para: Find unique numbers and their frequency in given array.

detaileddescription.para: All argument arrays are assumed to have the same length as the array holding the input numbers. If not all numbers are unique, the remaining entries in unique and count arguments are zero.

parameterdescription.para: input array of length n
array where unique numbers are stored, must be of length n
count[i] is how many times unique[i] appears in array in, must be of length n
length of the argument arrays

memberdef.argsstring: (const real key, const real *base, int num)
memberdef.name: math_rsearch

briefdescription.para: Search for array element preceding a key value.

detaileddescription.para: This function takes an array of real values and a key value, and finds the array element which precedes the key value. The array to be searched has to be in ascending sorted order (according to comparison function rcomp).

parameterdescription.para: real value that serves as key for the search
pointer to the first object of the array to be searched
number of elements in array

simplesect.para: pointer to array element preceding the key, or NULL if search failed

memberdef.argsstring: (real r, real z, real *rv, real *zv, int n)
memberdef.name: math_point_in_polygon

briefdescription.para: Check if coordinates are within polygon.

detaileddescription.para: This function checks if the given coordinates are within a 2D polygon using a modified axis crossing method [1]. Origin is moved to the coordinates and the number of wall segments crossing the positive r-axis are calculated. If this is odd, the point is inside the polygon.
[1] D.G. Alciatore, R. Miranda. A Winding Number and Point-in-Polygon Algorithm. Technical report, Colorado State University, 1995. http://www.engr.colostate.edu/~dga/dga/papers/point_in_polygon.pdf

parameterdescription.para: r coordinate
z coordinate
array of r points for the polygon
array of z points for the polygon
number of points in the polygon

briefdescription.para: Header file for math.c.
